title: How to Dance the Cha Cha Slide

steps.title: Start with your legs together in an open area.
steps.content: Start with your legs together in an open area. Your feet should be touching as close as possible. You can use a dance studio or a gym to practice this dance. You can also do this outside with some friends.

steps.title: Clap your hands.
steps.content: Clap your hands. This is just a simple hand-clapping motion on the offbeat of the song. While you’re clapping, bounce your body with the beat of the music. Don’t bounce too hard on your knees, and keep your body loose. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Hop forward when the song goes, “1 hop this time.”
steps.content: Hop forward when the song goes, “1 hop this time.” From the left, walk back and hop forward once. Keep your knees loose and gently bent slightly when you move. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Stomp your feet starting with your right foot.
steps.content: Stomp your feet starting with your right foot. First, stomp your right foot forward once. Firmly plant it on the ground in front of you. This should be a firm, stomping motion. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Stomp your left foot in front of you.
steps.content: Stomp your left foot in front of you. Follow your right foot with your left foot stomping out in front of you. It should also be as firm of a stomp as the right foot. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Do the cha-cha when the song says, “Cha-cha real smooth.”
steps.content: Do the cha-cha when the song says, “Cha-cha real smooth.” Step your right foot in front of your left. Your right foot should be just a few inches in front of your left foot. Sway your body as your foot goes in front of the other one, and move your arms with the flow of the music being played. [5] X Research source Step the left foot in front of the right foot. Like the previous step, move your left foot a few inches in front of the right while swaying your hip to the side. Move your arms with the music being played.

steps.title: Turn to your right and repeat the dance facing the other side of the room.
steps.content: Turn to your right and repeat the dance facing the other side of the room. While facing the right side of the room, take a step to your left and then back. This time you will hop forward twice. Land softly on the balls of your feet. Stomp your right and left feet twice in this round. [6] X Research source Slide to the left and then the right.

steps.title: Do a crisscross jump with your legs.
steps.content: Do a crisscross jump with your legs. Jump up and down to make them move in a scissor-like motion. The song tells you to do this twice while still facing the right side of the room. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat the Cha-Cha.
steps.content: Repeat the Cha-Cha. Make sure to rock back and forth on your feet as you move. Cross your right foot over your left, step back with the left foot. Step to the right, and step forward with the left foot. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Squat low when the song says, “How low can you go?”
steps.content: Squat low when the song says, “How low can you go?” Put your hands on your knees and move downwards. With your hands on your bent knees, move in a bouncing motion as you get lower to the ground. Move your whole body in this step, including your head and your rear end. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Straighten your knees, and then freeze in place.
steps.content: Straighten your knees, and then freeze in place. You should freeze in a pose for a few seconds. You should choose the most outrageous and fun position you can think of to freeze in, accented with a funny facial expression. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Clap your hands quickly.
steps.content: Clap your hands quickly. The song will tell you to clap your hands. Keep clapping to the beat until the next instruction is given. Bounce a bit on your knees in time with the beat of the song. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Pose funny when you freeze in place.
steps.content: Pose funny when you freeze in place. When the song tells you to freeze as you’re moving up from crouching, you can freeze in a crazy pose with a wild face. Hold your arms and hands at an angle, and make your face look silly. For example, you can stick out your tongue with your hands on both sides of your head.

steps.title: Hop like a rabbit to look cute.
steps.content: Hop like a rabbit to look cute. When you’re instructed to hop at different points in the song, hop like a rabbit. Even a frog or a kangaroo kind of hop would be fun and cute to do to make the move your own.

steps.title: Stomp with attitude.
steps.content: Stomp with attitude. When your stomp throughout the dance, put some force into your stomp to give it some attitude or style. Maybe you’re feeling frustrated and need to stomp to blow off steam. That’s a great excuse to stomp without being told you’re having a tantrum!

steps.title: Cha-Cha with more flare by moving your hips more.
steps.content: Cha-Cha with more flare by moving your hips more. If you’ve got the hang of the cha-cha step, you can do it with more flare and style. Move your hips more or move your arms more gracefully at your sides. Be lighter on your feet.
